page.title: 14 Ambhurst Trout Farm
page.content: At the Trout Farm we stopped at a house. There was nobody there so we got out of the car and looked around. We saw three calves four peacocks some ducks and two puppies.Then we saw someone who told us to come through. He said when the trout are ready to lay eggs the people at the farm have to squeeze the eggs out of the trout. The eggs have to be put in cold water. When the eggs hatch the there colour is plain grey then in about 2 years they turn spotted. When they are fully grown they rainbow coloured. The trout lay about 10,000 eggs a year.
